com.github.harverst.roper.model

Interface Character<S,P>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BasicCharacter

    public interface Character<S,P>
    Highly abstract and parameterized interface used to define characters. The template parameter S could be an enum that lists the different types of scores available in the game system referenced. The template parameter, P, defines the phases that can be used to order a score, usually an enum or numeric class.

    • Method Detail

      • getScoreGroup

        ScoreGroup<P> getScoreGroup(S group)
        Retrieves a score group of the given type. Note, this should be primarily used read-only as modifiers applied via the returned value will not be added to the history log.
        Parameters:
        group - The type of group being sought.

      • getScore

        Score<P> getScore(S group,
                int ordinal)
        Retrieves a score from the given type. Note that if a score stands alone, ordinal can be left as 0.
        Parameters:
        group - The type of score for a finite set of scores desired
        ordinal - The index in the order of the score

      • addGroupComponent

        void addGroupComponent(S group,
                     List<ScoreComponent<P>> component)
        Adds a set of components to the given group.
        Parameters:
        group - The type of group to composite with.
        component - The components to add

      • removeGroupComponent

        void removeGroupComponent(S group,
                        List<ScoreComponent<P>> component)
        Removes the components from the given group.
        Parameters:
        group - The type of group to remove the component from.
        component - The components to remove

      • addAction

        void addAction(Action anAction)
        Adds a capability to the character.
        Parameters:
        anAction - The capability being added to the character.

      • removeAction

        void removeAction(Action anAction)
        Removes a capability from the character.
        Parameters:
        anAction - The capability being removed from the character.

      • getActions

        List<Action> getActions()
        Gets the set of actions the character is capable. This should mostly match up with actions as defined in DnD Only case in which it might not match up is while out of battle

      • getHistory

        List<Event> getHistory()
        Log of actions that have happened to the character in chronological order.
        Returns:
        A full list of events usable to rollback a character entirely.

      • getFailedHistory

        List<Event> getFailedHistory()
        Logs actions that have failed, such as by throwing an exception. Note, this is particularly necessary for
        Returns:
        A full list of list of failed actions.
